issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.summary: 2NN will fail to checkpoint after an HDFS upgrade from a pre-federation version of HDFS

comments.body: Here's a patch which addresses the issue by only comparing the namespace IDs to determine if this is the same NN/2NN pair, instead of the NS IDs and BP IDs/Cluster IDs. NS IDs predate federation so this allows upgrades from pre-federation versions of HDFS. This patch also makes sure that we definitely reload the downloaded fsimage from disk in the case that we've identified that the 2NN's metadata does not match the layout version of the NN's.

                  org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.namenode.TestNameEditsConfigs

This message is automatically generated.
[~atm] Is this a 2.0.3 blocker? Tx.

[~acmurthy] Blocker? Probably not. Pretty good to have? I think so. There's a pretty simple work-around: when upgrading from a pre-federation version of HDFS, blow away your 2NN checkpoint dirs before starting up your 2NN again. A problem will arise if an admin doesn't notice that all of their 2NN checkpoints are failing post-upgrade.

Regardless, it's a pretty simple change - I'm hoping it can get committed today.

Thanks a lot for the review, Chris, and for running those additional tests.

Your suggestion does seem pretty paranoid (odds are 1 over 2^31), but better to be overly conservative in cases such as this. :)

Please take a look at the updated patch. This patch expressly checks to see if the local metadata's layout version supports federation or not, and only compares the namespace IDs if it doesn't support federation. If federation is supported, all three fields are compared.

+1 for the new patch

Tests pass with the new patch too.

Thank you for addressing the extremely paranoid feedback.  :-)
